meanings.definition: Relating to or involving all genes or hereditary factors.
meanings.sent1: The pangenetic study focused on how all genes contribute to inherited traits.
meanings.sent2: Scientists discussed the pangenetic influence of genes on physical features.
meanings.sent3: The pangenetic puzzle of genetics kept the researchers intrigued.
meanings.sent4: Her family tree was a pangenetic tapestry woven with genetic threads.
meanings.sent5: The concept of pangenetic inheritance was explained using a simple analogy.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the theory that hereditary characteristics are determined by a mixture of parental contributions.
meanings.sent1: The pangenetic theory suggests that traits come from a blend of parental genes.
meanings.sent2: In biology class, students learned about the pangenetic model of inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The pangenetic idea made the genetics lesson more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The siblings' resemblance was a pangenetic blend of their parents' features.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a pangenetic diagram to illustrate the theory to the class.
